rev.comment: rm 'controversy' section. the google/china controversy, as well as many other controversies, are covered in detail in the [[History of Google]] article.

â
==Controversy==
  â
In January, 2006, Google launched Google.cn, search engine dedicated to the China market, in which sensitive materials are censored. Google issued a statement, saying "in deciding how best to approach the Chinese--or any--market, we must balance our commitments to satisfy the interest of users, expand access to information, and respond to local conditions." [[Reporters Without Borders]] blasted Google, saying the company was taking an immoral position that could not be justified. Google argued that this approach is better than giving 1.3 billion none.
